page.title: 03GREENISLAND,PRIMARY SCHOOLS
page.content: { Nursery}Education is not available in the Greenisland area so the primary schools admit pupils at 4 years. Pre- school provision is made by a{play- {group}run by the social services in the Social Centre and a voluntary group held in the Methodist Hall. Greenisland children have 2 local {controlled}primary schools{Greenisland {P.S}(250 pupils)sited near the railway station and{Silverstream P.S}(150) in the lower estate.Near Station Road is a{maintained}school{(St.Colman's P.S., 20 pupils).Parents may send children to any primary or preparatory school inside or outside their area. { }In common with most N.I. children, local primary pupils,in their 11th year,take part in a{selection test} designed to assess their suitability for the 2 types of secondary schools provided.
